pages.body:
# Welcome to ZeroNet

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[Bittorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public, decentralized, [[cloning|clonable]] zite. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works. 

### Getting Started:
- [[zeronet|What is ZeroNet?]]
- [[zite|What is a "Zite"?]]

#### ZeroNet Websites (zites):
- [[zearch| List of Search Engines]] 
- [[List of Zites]]

#### Zeronet Information:
- [[hubs|List of ZeroMe Hubs]]
- [[proxies|List of proxies, allowing you to view ZeroNet from clearnet]]
- [[blocklists|Zeronet Blocklists]] 
- [[zerome|What is ZeroMe?]]

#### ZeroWiki Dev:
- [[ZeroWiki:Format|ZeroWiki writing format]]
- [[Dev ideas|Development ideas]]
- [[markdown|Markdown Formatting Syntax for ZeroWiki and ZeroTalk]]
- [[zerowikisandbox|Sandbox, you can play with it before editing other pages]]

#### Programming/Development:
- [[devresources|List of resources for ZeroNet and Zite development]]

#### Misc:
- [[wallofshame|The Copyright Wall of Shame Community Edition]]
- [[copytrollquotes|A Collection of Quotes by Copyright Trolls]]

#### Useful wikis:
 - [New ZeroWiki](/1LX2wiouHctuUXtu5WkVM9TJJ3YoL6gAfm/) - Clone of ZeroWiki
 - [ZeroTuto, learning resources and tutorials related to ZeroNet](/1Jtjb5CU9aod4jtz8hF5NPPqFKofRSsb4x/)
  
*Please note that [[ZeroWiki]] is still beta software, it may have bugs and lack some features
[[ZeroWiki:Issues|Propose features and report bugs here]].*

There are a number of search engines on ZeroNet which index [zites] and allows you to quickly find them. The most popular/used search engine is Kaffiene.

- [[bwoi]]
- [[DreamSearch]]
- [[EulerFinder]]
- [[Horizon]]
- [[Kaffiene]]
- [[Kidsearch]]
- [[RVRE]]
- [[Snifferdog]]
- [[ZeroSearch ]]
- [[Zirch]]
- [[Zoogle Zearch]]

*Note that links highlighted in red link to pages that have not yet been created. Please contribute to help create a better ZeroWiki.*

# Welcome to ZeroNet

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[Bittorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public, decentralized, [[cloning|clonable]] zite. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works. 

### Getting Started:
- [[zeronet|What is ZeroNet?]]
- [[zite|What is a "Zite"?]]

#### ZeroNet Websites (zites):
- [[zearch| List of Search Engines]] 
- [[List of Zites]]

#### Zeronet Information:
- [[hubs|List of ZeroMe Hubs]]
- [[proxies|List of proxies, allowing you to view ZeroNet from clearnet]]
- [[blocklists|Zeronet Blocklists]] 
- [[zerome|What is ZeroMe?]]

#### ZeroWiki Dev:

- [[Dev ideas|Development ideas]]

#### Programming/Development:

[[ZeroWiki:Issues|Propose features and report bugs here]].*

# ZeroNet

**ZeroNet** is a [[decentralized]] network of [[peer-to-peer]] users. It is built in [[Python]] and fully [[open source]], invented and created by [[nofish]]. Sites have specific addresses which can be accessed through a browser when using its client. ZeroNet is not [[anonymous]] by default, but users can hide their IP address by using the built in [[Tor]]-functionality. ZeroNet uses elliptic curve [[cryptography]] and the [[BitTorrent]] network.

Users can publish static or dynamic websites into ZeroNet and visitors automatically serve the visited website from their computer, with the option to stop serving the website at any time by either pausing or deleting it. Sites will remain online even if it is being served by only one [[peer-to-peer|peer]].

When changes are published by the site owner, connected [[nodes]] serving that site (previous visitors) will receive the updates done to the site's content.

ZeroNet comes with a built-in [[SQL]] [[database]]. This makes content-heavy site development easy. The [[database]] is also synced with hosting [[nodes]].

The existence of [[peer-to-peer]] online [[website]]s had been hypothesized for some time, with [[The Pirate Bay]] suggesting they would build such network, as well as [[BitTorrent Inc.]] which created the closed source [[Project Maelstrom]]. One other similar project is [[MaidSafe]], though it has not yet seen widespread use, and has been said to focus more on file storage.
